1_identification.description: Clear identification and mirroring of the user input/requirement for transparency.

data.requirement_text: [String] The verbatim text of the requirement to be analyzed (e.g., 'The system MUST...').

metadata.entity_name: [String] The internal model name for this requirement.
metadata.status: [String] Current status in the system (e.g., valid, draft).
metadata.source_origin: [String] Origin system of the data (e.g., Neo4J, XMI-Import).

2_knowledge_retrieval.description: Strict separation of facts found in the knowledge graph versus missing information.

found_facts: [String] List of specific nodes or documentation found in the database (e.g., 'Requirement X exists').
missing_elements: [String] Explicitly state what was searched for but NOT found (e.g., 'No SATISFIES relationship found').

3_analysis.description: Logic and reasoning layer where the model interprets the facts. Separation of fact vs. conclusion.

compliance_matrix.criteria: [String] The specific aspect being checked (e.g., 'Technical component modeled?').
compliance_matrix.result: [Boolean/String] Result of the check (e.g., Yes/No, Met/Not Met).

risk_assessment.justification: [String] Explanation of the risk (e.g., 'Mandatory requirement without implementation').

4_evaluation.description: The final verdict on whether the requirement is currently satisfied.

data.summary_reasoning: [String] A synthesis of why this verdict was reached based on the analysis (e.g., 'Requirement exists but lacks implementation proof').

5_recommendations.description: Concrete, actionable next steps for the user to resolve issues.

action_items: [String] Specific modeling tasks (e.g., 'Define a BusinessService for X').
[String] Missing attributes or compliance elements to add.

6_conversational_summary.description: A short, catchy conclusion suitable for a chat interface.

data.message: [String] A natural language summary of the result intended for the end user.
